newsitem.title: USA: Novell says core business grew 10 pct in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Novell says core business grew 10 pct in Q1.

text.p: Novell Inc said Wednesday its core business -- network server operating systems -- grew 10 percent from the year-ago period, to $251 million.
Within this segment, IntranetWare directory-enabled server products for intranets and the Internet grew 41 percent year-over-year to $185 million, it said.
The company disclosed the growth data as it announced revenue of $375 million and net income of $51 million, or $0.15 per share, for its first fiscal quarter ended Jan. 31, 1997.
These results compare with revenue of $438 million and net income of $64 million, or $0.17 per share, in the first quarter 1996, it said.
The year-earlier results included $61 million of revenue from discontinued or sold product lines and a one-time license payment associated with the sale of UnixWare, it said.

Joseph Marengi, president and chief operating officer of the network software company said, "Despite market weakness in Europe and Japan that resulted in a slight sequential decline in revenue, we shipped more than 250,000 network server operating systems in the first quarter.

"We expect the current base of more than 20 million Novell directory services users to grow substantially in 1997, he said, adding that a leading factor in this development will be IntranetWare server growth.
Also contributing by the end of the year will be an expanding number of UNIX and Microsoft NT servers that take advantage of Novell network directory services, he said.
